page.title: 17SCHOOLS
page.content: All levels of schooling are represented here, reflecting the fact that the community has a well distributed age structure. The Infants school is a product of the early 1970's and has a roll of 231.It caters for the rising fives to seven year olds.Because of the nature of its setting it tends to have a continuous attendance in families. The Junior school is housed in two blocks built in 1907 and 1927 and caters for the seven to eleven year olds.Due to the fall in school rolls in the 1970's, it has spare classrooms which are used for specialist teaching and it also retains long standing family links within the village. The John Penrose Senior school was opened in 1954 and provides the rest of the schooling for the community.
